definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: Photos on the popular Weibo microblogging service showed backhoes burying the wrecked train near the site.
sentences.chinese: 圍脖上的照片顯示挖土地就地掩埋列車殘骸。

sentences.english: And Beckham will have a scarf to wear as well after wrapping himself in green and gold as he made his way off the field.
sentences.chinese: 同時貝克漢姆在下場時戴上了綠金色的圍脖。

sentences.english: Soon her boa is on the floor and her hair is mussed and sticky.
sentences.chinese: 她的白色圍脖不小心掉在了地上，露出粘粘的亂髮。

sentences.english: He knots his simple, black neckwarmer just the right way, threaded through a loop like a pro.
sentences.chinese: 他簡單的黑色圍脖被很巧妙地從一個環中穿過。

sentences.english: I had loosened the golden muffler that he always wore.
sentences.chinese: 我解開了他一直帶着的金黃色的圍脖。

sentences.english: International football authorities have stepped into the world of fashion and banned snoods, or neck-warmers, for footballers.
sentences.chinese: 國際足球當局已介入足球隊員的時尚和圍脖領域。

sentences.english: The fox goes very well with your cap.
sentences.chinese: 這狐皮圍脖與你的帽子很相配。

definition: to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
to stand in a circle and watch
mythical horse/Internet slang for 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]
a favorite of sb in power/a celebrity/American Indian
trumpet/small size (clothes etc)/(coll.) number one/to urinate/(humble) our store
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
